section.title: redis() destination options
section.para: The redis() driver sends messages as name-value pairs to a Redis key-value store.
The redis() destination has the following options:

simplesect.title: auth()
simplesect.para: Description: The password used for authentication on a password-protected Redis server. Available in &abbrev; version 3.10 and later.

simplesect.title: command()
simplesect.para: Description: The Redis command to execute, for example, LPUSH, INCR, or HINCRBY. Using the HINCRBY command with an increment value of 1 allows you to create various statistics. For example, the command("HINCRBY" "${HOST}/programs" "${PROGRAM}" "1") command counts the number of log messages on each host for each program.
Note the following points when using the redis() destination:

listitem.para: You can use macros and templates in the parameters of the Redis command.
Currently you can use only one command in a redis() destination.
The &abbrev; application ignores the return value of the command. If the Redis server returns an error, &abbrev; closes the connection.

simplesect.title: host()
simplesect.para: Description: The hostname or IP address of the Redis server.

simplesect.title: port()
simplesect.para: Description: The port number of the Redis server.
